member.name: T:Yarn.Line
member.summary: A line of dialogue, sent from the to the game.

remarks.para: When the game receives a , it should do the following things to prepare the line for presentation to the user.

list.item: Use the value in the field to look up the appropriate user-facing text in the string table.
Use to replace all substitutions in the user-facing text.
Use to parse all markup in the line.

remarks.para: You do not create instances of this struct yourself. They are created by the during program execution.

member.name: F:Yarn.Line.ID
member.summary: The string ID for this line.

member.name: F:Yarn.Line.Substitutions
member.summary: The values that should be inserted into the user-facing text before delivery.

member.name: T:Yarn.OptionSet
member.summary: A set of s, sent from the to the game.
member.remarks: You do not create instances of this struct yourself. They are created by the during program execution.

member.name: T:Yarn.OptionSet.Option
member.summary: An option to be presented to the user.

member.name: P:Yarn.OptionSet.Option.Line
member.summary: Gets the that should be presented to the user for this option.
member.remarks: See the documentation for the class for information on how to prepare a line before presenting it to the user.

member.name: P:Yarn.OptionSet.Option.ID
member.summary: Gets the identifying number for this option.
member.remarks: When the user selects this option, this value should be used as the parameter for .

member.name: P:Yarn.OptionSet.Option.DestinationNode
member.summary: Gets the name of the node that will be run if this option is selected.
member.remarks: The value of this property not be valid if this is a shortcut option.

member.name: P:Yarn.OptionSet.Option.IsAvailable
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the player should be permitted to select this option.

remarks.para: If this value is , this option had a line condition on it that failed. The option will still be delivered to the game, but, depending on the needs of the game, the game may decide to not allow the player to select it, or not offer it to the player at all.
This is intended for situations where games wish to show options that the player _could_ have taken, if some other condition had been met (e.g. having enough "charisma" points).

member.name: P:Yarn.OptionSet.Options
member.summary: Gets the s that should be presented to the user.

member.name: T:Yarn.Command
member.summary: A command, sent from the to the game.
member.remarks: You do not create instances of this struct yourself. They are created by the during program execution.

member.name: P:Yarn.Command.Text
member.summary: Gets the text of the command.

member.name: T:Yarn.Logger
member.summary: Represents a method that receives diagnostic messages and error information from a .
member.remarks: The text that this delegate receives may be output to a console, or sent to a log.
member.param: The text that should be logged.

member.name: T:Yarn.VariableKind
member.summary: Represents different kinds of variables that can be fetched from a using .

member.name: F:Yarn.VariableKind.Unknown
member.summary: The kind of the variable cannot be determined. It may not be known to the system.

member.name: F:Yarn.VariableKind.Stored
member.summary: The variable's value is stored in memory, and may be persisted to disk.

member.name: F:Yarn.VariableKind.Smart
member.summary: The variable's value is computed at run-time, and is not persisted to disk.

member.name: T:Yarn.IVariableAccess
member.summary: Provides a mechanism for retrieving values.

member.name: M:Yarn.IVariableAccess.TryGetValue``1(System.String,``0@)
member.summary: Given a variable name, attempts to fetch a value for the variable, either from storage, initial values found in , or by evaluating a smart variable found in .
member.typeparam: The type of the value to return. The fetched value will be converted to this type.
member.param: The name of the variable.
If this method returns , this parameter will contain the fetched value.
member.returns: if a value could be fetched; otherwise.

member.name: M:Yarn.IVariableAccess.GetVariableKind(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the kind of variable named .
member.param: The name of the variable.
member.returns: A enum representing the kind of the variable named .

member.name: P:Yarn.IVariableAccess.Program
member.summary: Gets or sets the Yarn that stores information about the initial values of variables, and is able to produce values for smart variables.

member.name: P:Yarn.IVariableAccess.SmartVariableEvaluator
member.summary: Gets or sets the object to use when evaluating smart variables.

member.name: T:Yarn.IVariableStorage
member.summary: Provides a mechanism for storing values.

member.summary: Stores a in this VariableStorage.
member.param: The name to associate with this variable.
The string to store.

member.name: M:Yarn.IVariableStorage.SetValue(System.String,System.Single)
member.summary: Stores a in this VariableStorage.
member.param: The name to associate with this variable.
The number to store.

member.name: M:Yarn.IVariableStorage.SetValue(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Stores a in this VariableStorage.
member.param: The name to associate with this variable.
The boolean value to store.

member.name: M:Yarn.IVariableStorage.Clear
member.summary: Removes all variables from storage.

member.name: T:Yarn.MemoryVariableStore
member.summary: A simple concrete implementation of that keeps all variables in memory.

member.name: T:Yarn.LineHandler
member.summary: Represents the method that is called when the Dialogue delivers a .
member.param: The that has been delivered.

member.name: T:Yarn.OptionsHandler
member.summary: Represents the method that is called when the Dialogue delivers an .
member.param: The that has been delivered.

member.name: T:Yarn.CommandHandler
member.summary: Represents the method that is called when the Dialogue delivers a .
member.param: The that has been delivered.

member.name: T:Yarn.NodeCompleteHandler
member.summary: Represents the method that is called when the Dialogue reaches the end of a node.
member.param: The name of the node.
member.remarks: This method may be called multiple times over the course of code execution. A node being complete does not necessarily represent the end of the conversation.

member.name: T:Yarn.NodeStartHandler
member.summary: Represents the method that is called when the Dialogue begins executing a node.
member.param: The name of the node.

member.name: T:Yarn.DialogueCompleteHandler
member.summary: Represents the method that is called when the dialogue has reached its end, and no more code remains to be run.

member.name: T:Yarn.PrepareForLinesHandler
member.summary: Represents the method that is called when the dialogue anticipates that it will deliver lines.

remarks.para: This method should begin preparing to run the lines. For example, if a game delivers dialogue via voice-over, the appropriate audio files should be loaded.
This method serves to provide a hint to the game that a line _may_ be run. Not every line indicated in may end up actually running.
This method may be called any number of times during a dialogue session.

member.param: The collection of line IDs that may be delivered at some point soon.

member.name: T:Yarn.Dialogue
member.summary: Co-ordinates the execution of Yarn programs.

member.name: P:Yarn.Dialogue.VariableStorage
member.summary: Gets or sets the object that provides access to storing and retrieving the values of variables.

member.name: P:Yarn.Dialogue.LogDebugMessage
member.summary: Invoked when the Dialogue needs to report debugging information.

member.name: P:Yarn.Dialogue.LogErrorMessage
member.summary: Invoked when the Dialogue needs to report an error.

member.name: F:Yarn.Dialogue.DefaultStartNodeName
member.summary: The node that execution will start from.

member.name: P:Yarn.Dialogue.Program
member.summary: Gets or sets the compiled Yarn program.

member.name: P:Yarn.Dialogue.IsActive
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the Dialogue is currently executing Yarn instructions.

member.name: P:Yarn.Dialogue.LineHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets the that is called when a line is ready to be shown to the user.

member.name: P:Yarn.Dialogue.LanguageCode
member.summary: Gets or sets the 's locale, as an IETF BCP 47 code.

remarks.para: This code is used to determine how the plural and ordinal markers determine the plural class of numbers.
For example, the code "en-US" represents the English language as used in the United States.

member.name: P:Yarn.Dialogue.OptionsHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets the that is called when a set of options are ready to be shown to the user.
member.remarks: The Options Handler delivers an to the game. Before can be called to resume execution, must be called to indicate which was selected by the user. If is not called, an exception is thrown.

member.name: P:Yarn.Dialogue.CommandHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets the that is called when a command is to be delivered to the game.

member.name: P:Yarn.Dialogue.NodeStartHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets the that is called when a node is started.

member.name: P:Yarn.Dialogue.NodeCompleteHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets the that is called when a node is complete.

member.name: P:Yarn.Dialogue.DialogueCompleteHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets the that is called when the dialogue reaches its end.

member.name: P:Yarn.Dialogue.PrepareForLinesHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets the that is called when the dialogue anticipates delivering some lines.

member.name: F:Yarn.Dialogue.vm
member.summary: The virtual machine to use when running dialogue.

member.name: F:Yarn.Dialogue.smartVariableVM
member.summary: The virtual machine to use when evaluating smart variables.
member.remarks: This is kept separate from the main VM in order to prevent evaluating smart variables from modifying the evaluation state of dialogue.

member.name: P:Yarn.Dialogue.Library
member.summary: Gets the that this Dialogue uses to locate functions.
member.remarks: When the Dialogue is constructed, the Library is initialized with the built-in operators like +, -, and so on.

member.name: P:Yarn.Dialogue.ContentSaliencyStrategy
member.summary: Gets or sets the content saliency strategy used by this .
member.remarks: A content saliency strategy is a class that implements and selects the most appropriate content in a line group, or any other situation where content saliency is relevant.

member.name: M:Yarn.Dialogue.#ctor(Yarn.IVariableStorage)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The that this Dialogue should use.

member.name: M:Yarn.Dialogue.SetProgram(Yarn.Program)
member.summary: Loads all nodes from the provided .
member.remarks: This method replaces any existing nodes have been loaded.
member.param: The to use.

member.name: M:Yarn.Dialogue.LoadProgram(System.String)
member.summary: Loads a compiled from a file.
member.param: The path of the file to load.

remarks.para: This method replaces the current value of with the result of loading the file.
This method does not compile Yarn source. To compile Yarn source code into a , Refer to the Yarn compiler.

member.name: M:Yarn.Dialogue.SetNode(System.String)
member.summary: Prepares the that the user intends to start running a node.
member.param: The name of the node that will be run. The node have been loaded by calling or .

remarks.para: After this method is called, you call to start executing it.
If has been set, it may be called when this method is invoked, as the Dialogue determines which lines may be delivered during the node's execution.

member.throws: Thrown when no node named startNode has been loaded.

member.name: M:Yarn.Dialogue.SetSelectedOption(System.Int32)
member.summary: Signals to the that the user has selected a specified .

remarks.para: After the Dialogue delivers an , this method must be called before is called.
The ID number that should be passed as the parameter to this method should be the field in the that represents the user's selection.

member.param: The ID number of the Option that the user selected.
member.throws: Thrown when the Dialogue is not expecting an option to be selected.
Thrown when selectedOptionID is not a valid option ID.

member.name: M:Yarn.Dialogue.Continue
member.summary: Starts, or continues, execution of the current Program.

remarks.para: This method repeatedly executes instructions until one of the following conditions is encountered:

list.item: The or is called. After calling either of these handlers, the Dialogue will wait until is called. Continue may be called from inside the or , or may be called at any future time.
The is called. When this occurs, the Dialogue is waiting for the user to specify which of the options has been selected, and must be called before is called again.)
The Program reaches its end. When this occurs, must be called before is called again.
An error occurs while executing the Program.

remarks.para: This method has no effect if it is called while the is currently in the process of executing instructions.

member.name: M:Yarn.Dialogue.Stop
member.summary: Immediately stops the .
member.remarks: The will not be called if the dialogue is ended by calling .

member.name: P:Yarn.Dialogue.NodeNames
member.summary: Gets the names of the nodes in the currently loaded Program.

member.name: P:Yarn.Dialogue.CurrentNode
member.summary: Gets the name of the node that this Dialogue is currently executing.
member.remarks: If has never been called, this value will be .

member.name: M:Yarn.Dialogue.GetStringIDForNode(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the string ID that contains the original, uncompiled source text for a node.
member.param: The name of the node.
member.returns: The string ID.

remarks.para: A node's source text will only be present in the string table if its tags header contains rawText.

Because the class is designed to be unaware of the contents of the string table, this method does not test to see if the string table contains an entry with the line ID. You will need to test for that yourself.

member.name: M:Yarn.Dialogue.GetTagsForNode(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the tags for the node .
member.remarks: The tags for a node are defined by setting the tags header in the node's source code. This header must be a space-separated list.
member.param: The name of the node.
member.returns: The node's tags, or if the node is not present in the Program.

member.name: M:Yarn.Dialogue.UnloadAll
member.summary: Unloads all nodes from the Dialogue.

member.name: M:Yarn.Dialogue.GetByteCode
member.summary: Returns a textual version of the current program's bytecode.
member.remarks: This can be useful for diagnostic purposes.
member.returns: The bytecode of , as a string.

member.name: M:Yarn.Dialogue.NodeExists(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether a specified node exists in the Program.
member.param: The name of the node.
member.returns: if a node named nodeName exists in the Program, otherwise.

member.summary: Begins analysis of the by the
member.param: The Context that performs the analysis

member.summary: Parses a line of text, and produces a containing the results.
member.remarks: The 's will have any select, plural or ordinal markers replaced with the appropriate text, following this 's .
member.param: The line of text to parse.
member.returns: The results of parsing the markup.

member.name: M:Yarn.Dialogue.ExpandSubstitutions(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.String})
member.summary: Replaces all substitution markers in a text with the given substitution list.
member.remarks: This method replaces substitution markers - for example, {0} - with the corresponding entry in . If contains a substitution marker whose index is not present in , it is ignored.
member.param: The text containing substitution markers.
The list of substitutions.
member.returns: , with the content from inserted.

member.name: F:Yarn.Dialogue.ValuePlaceholderRegex
member.summary: A regex that matches any % as long as it's not preceded by a \.

member.name: M:Yarn.Library.GenerateUniqueVisitedVariableForNode(System.String)
member.summary: Generates a unique tracking variable name. This is intended to be used to generate names for visting. Ideally these will very reproduceable and sensible. For now it will be something terrible and easy.

member.returns: The new variable name.

A single Yarn instruction.

member.name: F:Yarn.Instruction.OpcodeFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "opcode" field.

member.summary: The operation that this instruction will perform.

member.summary: Field number for the "operands" field.

member.summary: The list of operands, if any, that this instruction uses.

member.name: T:Yarn.Instruction.Types
member.summary: Container for nested types declared in the Instruction message type.

member.name: T:Yarn.Instruction.Types.OpCode
member.summary: The type of instruction that this is.

member.name: F:Yarn.Instruction.Types.OpCode.JumpTo
member.summary: Jumps to a named position in the node. opA = string: label name

member.name: F:Yarn.Instruction.Types.OpCode.Jump
member.summary: Peeks a string from stack, and jumps to that named position in the node. No operands.

member.name: F:Yarn.Instruction.Types.OpCode.RunLine
member.summary: Delivers a string ID to the client. opA = string: string ID

member.name: F:Yarn.Instruction.Types.OpCode.RunCommand
member.summary: Delivers a command to the client. opA = string: command text

member.name: F:Yarn.Instruction.Types.OpCode.AddOption
member.summary: Adds an entry to the option list (see ShowOptions). - opA = string: string ID for option to add - opB = string: destination to go to if this option is selected - opC = number: number of expressions on the stack to insert into the line - opD = bool: whether the option has a condition on it (in which case a value should be popped off the stack and used to signal the game that the option should be not available)

member.name: F:Yarn.Instruction.Types.OpCode.ShowOptions
member.summary: Presents the current list of options to the client, then clears the list. The most recently selected option will be on the top of the stack when execution resumes. No operands.

member.name: F:Yarn.Instruction.Types.OpCode.PushString
member.summary: Pushes a string onto the stack. opA = string: the string to push to the stack.

member.name: F:Yarn.Instruction.Types.OpCode.PushFloat
member.summary: Pushes a floating point number onto the stack. opA = float: number to push to stack

member.name: F:Yarn.Instruction.Types.OpCode.PushBool
member.summary: Pushes a boolean onto the stack. opA = bool: the bool to push to stack

member.name: F:Yarn.Instruction.Types.OpCode.PushNull
member.summary: Pushes a null value onto the stack. No operands.

member.name: F:Yarn.Instruction.Types.OpCode.JumpIfFalse
member.summary: Jumps to the named position in the the node, if the top of the stack is not null, zero or false. opA = string: label name

member.name: F:Yarn.Instruction.Types.OpCode.Pop
member.summary: Discards top of stack. No operands.

member.name: F:Yarn.Instruction.Types.OpCode.CallFunc
member.summary: Calls a function in the client. Pops as many arguments as the client indicates the function receives, and the result (if any) is pushed to the stack. opA = string: name of the function

member.name: F:Yarn.Instruction.Types.OpCode.PushVariable
member.summary: Pushes the contents of a variable onto the stack. opA = name of variable

member.name: F:Yarn.Instruction.Types.OpCode.StoreVariable
member.summary: Stores the contents of the top of the stack in the named variable. opA = name of variable

member.name: F:Yarn.Instruction.Types.OpCode.Stop
member.summary: Stops execution of the program. No operands.

member.name: F:Yarn.Instruction.Types.OpCode.RunNode
member.summary: Pops a string off the top of the stack, and runs the node with that name. No operands.

member.name: T:Yarn.Saliency.BestLeastRecentlyViewedSalienceStrategy
member.summary: A content saliency strategy that returns the first of the best, least-recently seen choices from the provided options.

member.name: T:Yarn.Saliency.BestSaliencyStrategy

member.remarks: This strategy always returns the single best of the available items, regardless of whether it has been seen before. For a saliency strategy that takes into account how recently content has been seen, see .

member.summary: A content saliency strategy that always returns the first item in the list of available options.

member.name: M:Yarn.Markup.LineParser.RegisterMarkerProcessor(System.String,Yarn.Markup.IAttributeMarkerProcessor)
member.summary: Registers an object as a marker processor for a given marker name.
member.remarks: When a marker processor is registered for a marker name, the parser will ask the processor for text to insert into the plain text. This allows users of the class to dynamically replace text in a line. The nomarkup tag is implemented in this way by the class directly; the class uses this mechanism to implement the select, plural and ordinal markers.
member.param: The name of the marker that should use this marker processor.
The object that should be invoked when markers with this name are encountered.

member.name: M:Yarn.Markup.LineParser.ParseValue
member.summary: Parses a property value.
member.remarks:
Permitted value types are:
Integers
Floating-point numbers
Strings (delimited by double quotes). (Strings may contain escaped quotes with a backslash.)
The words true or false
Runs of alphanumeric characters, up to but not including a whitespace or the end of a tag; these are interpreted as a string (e.g. [mood=happy] is interpreted the same as [mood="happy"]
Expressions (delimited by curly braces), which are processed as inline expressions.
member.returns: The parsed value.

member.name: M:Yarn.Markup.LineParser.Peek(System.Char)

member.remarks: This method returns false if the parser has reached the end of the line.
member.param: The character to look for.
member.returns: True if the next character is , false otherwise.

member.returns: True if the next character is whitespace, false otherwise.

member.returns: True if the next character is numeric, false otherwise.

member.summary: Gets the first attribute with the specified name, if present.
member.param: The name of the attribute to get.
When this method returns, contains the attribute with the specified name, if the attribute is found; otherwise, the default . This parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: if the contains an attribute with the specified name; otherwise, .

member.name: M:Yarn.Markup.MarkupParseResult.TextForAttribute(Yarn.Markup.MarkupAttribute)
member.summary: Returns the substring of covered by Position and Length properties.

remarks.para: If the attribute's property is zero, this method returns the empty string.

This method does not check to see if is an attribute belonging to this MarkupParseResult. As a result, if you pass an attribute that doesn't belong, it may describe a range of text that does not appear in . If this occurs, an will be thrown.

member.param: The attribute to get the text for.
member.returns: The text contained within the attribute.
member.throws: Thrown when attribute's and properties describe a range of text outside the maximum range of .

member.name: M:Yarn.Markup.MarkupParseResult.DeleteRange(Yarn.Markup.MarkupAttribute)
member.summary: Deletes an attribute from this markup.
member.remarks:
This method deletes the range of text covered by , and updates the other attributes in this markup as follows:
Attributes that start and end before the deleted attribute are unmodified.
Attributes that start before the deleted attribute and end inside it are truncated to remove the part overlapping the deleted attribute.
Attributes that have the same position and length as the deleted attribute are deleted, if they apply to any text.
Attributes that start and end within the deleted attribute are deleted.
Attributes that start within the deleted attribute, and end outside it, have their start truncated to remove the part overlapping the deleted attribute.
Attributes that start after the deleted attribute have their start point adjusted to account for the deleted text.
This method does not modify the current object. A new is returned.
If is not an attribute of this , the behaviour is undefined.
member.param: The attribute to remove.
member.returns: A new object, with the plain text modified and an updated collection of attributes.

member.summary: Represents a marker (e.g. [a]) in line of marked up text.
member.remarks: You do not create instances of this struct yourself. It is created by objects that can parse markup, such as .

member.remarks: For example, the marker [wave] has the name wave.
